agenda.description: ** REVISION ** SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Business & Commerce TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, March 26, 2019 PLACE: E1.012 (Hearing Room) CHAIR: Senator Kelly Hancock To be considered: SB 296 Buckingham Relating to the abolition of student loan default or breach of a student loan repayment or scholarship contract as a ground for nonrenewal or other disciplinary action in relation to a professional or occupational license and to certain duties of state agencies and political subdivisions in relation to delinquent or defaulted student loans. SB 590 Watson Relating to the cancellation and nonrenewal of certain liability and commercial property insurance policies. SB 645 Birdwell | et al. Relating to restrictions on holders of package store permits. SB 787 Hancock Relating to a reduced licensing fee for certain former license holders. SB 928 Hancock Relating to the importation and use for manufacturing purposes of malt beverages by the holder of a brewer's permit or manufacturer's license. SB 943 Watson | et al. Relating to the disclosure of certain contracting information under the public information law. SB 944 Watson Relating to the public information law. SB 988 Watson Relating to the assessment of litigation costs and attorney's fees in certain actions under the public information law. SB 1200 Campbell | et al. Relating to the authority of certain military spouses to engage in a business or occupation in this state. SB 1210 Hancock Relating to the removal of certain alcoholic beverages that become unfit for consumption after a natural disaster. SB 1232 Creighton Relating to the delivery of alcoholic beverages by the holder of a wine and beer retailer's permit. SB 1414 Hancock Relating to fees regarding a residential tenant's failure to timely pay rent. SB 1450 Hancock Relating to a permit authorizing the delivery of alcoholic beverages from the premises of certain alcoholic beverage retailers to consumers; authorizing a fee. SB 1461 Nichols Relating to the sale of alcoholic beverages on certain property owned by the Texas State Railroad Authority. SB 1490 Campbell Relating to the authority of certain holders of a wine and beer retailer's permit to manufacture and sell wine and engage in certain related activities. SB 1494 Paxton Relating to the confidentiality of personal information of certain employees and contractors of the Department of Family and Protective Services. SB 1531 Hancock Relating to the eligibility for certain occupational licenses and the use of a person's criminal history as grounds for certain actions related to the license. SB 1532 Hancock Relating to the licensing and regulation of certain occupations and activities; authorizing fees. SB 1821 Campbell Relating to enforcement of the regulation of perpetual care cemeteries. SB 1822 Campbell Relating to prepaid funeral benefits. SB 1823 Campbell Relating to the regulation of state banks, state trust companies, and third-party service providers of state banks and state trust companies. SB 1939 Hancock | et al. Relating to the storage of grapes in a public warehouse. Pending Business Public testimony will be limited to 3 minutes. If submitting written testimony, please provide 20 copies to the committee clerk with your name and bill number on each copy. You may register for this hearing using the Senate kiosk located in the extension hallways or by going to http://swrs. Bills deleted after last posting: SB 444 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions of the schedule **
